data.title: Terrible Hotel
data.text: Stayed here with two friends. When we checked out, I looked at my bank statement and saw a $200 charge to my card from the hotel. I call them and they say that the charge was for smoking in the hotel room. I was extremely confused because my friends and I are smart enough to not smoke in the hotel room understanding that this is a non-smoking hotel. Every time we wanted to smoke, we went outside and did it far from the hotel. The manager told me they had found crumbs of marijuana in the room, but that does not mean we smoked in it. She then said it costs them $500 to get rid of the smell but I have a strong feeling they did not have to spend that money because the smell does not exist. We did not smoke in the hotel nor did we have enough marijuana to cause the smell to stay in the room. They turned "finding crumbs of marijuana" into "smoking in the hotel room". It's extremely disappointing because my friends and I are very responsible and for this to happen to us makes no sense. We were charged for something we DID NOT DO. Smokers beware, don't leave crumbs behind. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

owner_response.author: IHGService, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites: Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Supertramp808,

Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your thoughts about our hotel. We rely on guest feedback as this will allow us to improve wherever possible. I sincerely  regret the inconvenience this may have caused you at check out and to be charged for smoking in the room. I would like to look into this further, thus, I have sent you a private message to get additional information regarding this matter.

Again, thank you for your feedback and we hope to hear from you soon.

Sincerely,

Dianne L.
Case Manager
IHGService
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very Nice
data.text: After reading some of these reviews, I wasn't expecting much, but I was pleasantly surprised. I thought the lobby and hallways were clean and elegant looking. Our room was fine and had a large bathroom. A very nice selection at breakfast. An easy walk to Mangianno's or Landry's Seafood restaurants. For the price we paid I thought this suited our needs very well.

data.title: Tiny old rooms
data.text: Thought this would be a convenient overnight before a Broncos game.  Would not stay again unless we had to.  The hotel is past it's prime and needs updating.  Rooms are tiny.  The bathroom door almost touches the toilet and must be closed for any maneuvering between the sink and shower.  Bed and pillows just okay.  We could easily hear the neighbors doing their thing and other outside noises.  Also front desk staff not the most friendly or helpful

owner_response.author: IHGService, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites: Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Mark T,

Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your stay. It is good to read you appreciate our bed and pillow option. It is unfortunate the level of staff service, noise disturbance as well as the room condition prevented you from fully enjoying your time at the hotel. We have forwarded your comments to the appropriate department and people for review. We are confident the necessary adjustments will be made, in order to achieve complete guest satisfaction. 

Thank you again for your comments and for choosing to stay with us. We look forward to serving you in the future and provide you with a better experience.

Sincerely, 
 
Zelyn N.
Case Manager 
IHGService
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: From the time I checked in Renya made everything feel like family!
data.text:
In the Denver Tech Center, Renya made everything feel like family. It wasn't just her; it was her whole staff that did. Amanda helped me find my way to Mount Evans and there was a gentleman there with the name starting with B that too their busy time out to map out everything for me and never making me feel like I was less than a burden with all thane calls they were answering. 

Their third shift lady (Gosh, I forget her name) was most polite and informative as I am a night owl. 

When I come back, I would never stay elsewhere. I felt very, very safe there. Near there I would not. Never had a problem and they allow small pets which are always nice to see as they  make you smile!

I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends alike.

Did I mention housekeeping/? They were incredible. I travel around the world and I will tell you they are the honest, nicest people you will ever meet.
Whoever owns this place is lucky to have such a great staff. It makes up for tor the long updating and price it should be. My only vice was that it was very, very outdated. 
The staff will keep me coming back. I do hope not just management reads this; but the owners too. Your team of expertise made me want to stay there at Holiday Inn when I come back in November. I travel to Denver 4 or more times a year and Renya and her team are AMAZING!

I wish I had her and your staff to run  my company.

Sincerely,

J McGraw

owner_response.author: , General Manager at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites: Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Ms. Jennifer -

Thank you so much for taking the time to complete a survey about your stay with us.  I am very pleased to hear my staff went over and beyond to make sure you had a memorable stay! We strive to provide superb service  to every guest, with every stay , everyday! We value your feedback. Thank you for choosing the Holiday Inn Express DTC for your hotel accommodations while in Denver. We lookk forward to your return!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Military Families
data.text: This hotel is military family friendly. We stayed here in one room while our son and his family shared another room. The cookies were warm, the breakfast was good, and the coffee was tasty. The staff was very respectful of the reason we were there and they were very friendly as well. The beds are comfortable the rooms were nice.

owner_response.author: Sonya T, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites: Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello and thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback on your recent stay at the Holiday Inn Express & Suites Englewood DTC. We are thrilled you and your family enjoyed your rooms and your stay with us. We love our military family and appreciate all you do to keep this country safe, the least we can do is take care of you while you are visiting. We again are so happy to see you enjoyed your stay and we hope to see you again the next time you are in the Denver area!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good Place to stay
data.text: I stayed here for 5 days and found good. This is a good property to stay here but I feel the property needs a revamp as  the carpets look pretty old. Front desk is very helpful. Location is at the convenient place. Breakfast is 'ok' type and not bad.

owner_response.author: Sonya T, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites: Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Good Day,
Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback on your recent stay with us. We are more than thrilled you enjoyed your stay with us. We are happy our front desk was able to help you out with any issues as well as our location was convenient you. We do hope the next time you are in town, we see you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Up your game
data.text:
I am a spire level member of IHG rewards. As such I stay at IHG properties regularly and often. I have come to expect and appreciate a certain level of service and expertise. I understand the kind of traveler HIE markets to and generally find the service and amenities more than acceptable. Having said that, this property seems to constantly under perform. I stay at this property as much as I do at any HIE. Most years 15 to 30 nights. I recently had a stay there for three nights requiring 2 rooms.
I choose this property because of the location and to collect the IHG Rewards points.
The staff is generally friendly, but often poorly trained and uninformed. The turn over in staff seems to be very high, higher than other IHG properties I visit. 
If you are an IHG member and want your Welcome Amenity points you may as well forget it. I rarely receive them at this location. 
On my last visit a few weeks ago there was an issue with the satellite television system that was an issue for the entire three night stay. I was told that it would be resolved, but that never happened. As usual, I did not receive the 500 Welcome Amenity points that are offered Spire level members. I have sent two emails to the hotel with no response. 
If you need a mid lever hotel located in the Denver Tech Center area, I recommend you try another hotel. I have decided to do so as it is not worth the aggravation.

owner_response.author: IHGService, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites: Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Ray M,

Thank you for your patronage as one of our Spire Elite members. We constantly strive to provide an environment of comfort and value to our guests, therefore, we are sincerely concerned that we have fallen short of your expectations. Please accept our apologies for the service deficiencies you have experienced at our hotel. We will address these matters with the respective departments in order to avoid unnecessary issues in the future. In the meantime, I have sent you a private message to follow-up on your additional comments, especially with your welcome bonus points. I look forward to hearing from you and being of assistance.

Regards,

Tracy V.
Case Manager
IHGService
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: To many issues
data.text:
My family and I travels a lot.  We've been all over the nation and international.  We've stayed at many name brand hotels and resorts.

However, this hotel really has issues.  TV not working properly.  3 out of a 5 night stay was very frustrating.  Not only was the TV blinking in and out but the volume also.  It will give you a headache.  

If you are going out to tour the town, you need to return by 6:30pm.   A 5:30pm return will be to early for the room to be cleaned.

Staff is nice but very slow with accommodations.

owner_response.author: Sonya T, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites: Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hell traveleraz322,
Thank you for taking the time to review you stay at the Holiday Inn Express Englewood. I would like to extend my sincerest apologies to you and your family for the issues you encountered during your stay. We recently ordered new televisions for our rooms, but are having issues with the provider. We hope to have this resolved soon. Again, thank you for your feed back and we hope the next time you are in the area you give us another try.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Liked the room!
data.text: We got a suite and it was great for our family as everyone had a bed to sleep on. Very happy with that. However, we were at the front desk for 15 minutes and there was no one in sight! Finally a clerk showed up and told us he was helping another guest. I get that happens but 15 minutes! Apparently they are understaffed. All in all it met HIE standards and price was reasonable.

owner_response.author: Sonya T, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites: Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Good Day Dave4242,
Thank you for your feedback of your recent stay at the Holiday Inn Express Denver Tech Center. We are thrilled you and your family were accommodated well in our spacious suites. I would however like to apologize for the inconvenience of your wait before checking in. Again, thank you for your feedback and we hope to see your family again the next time your travels bring you to the Denver Tech Center.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good, comfortable hotel, let down by inadequate wifi.
data.text: We stayed at this hotel for 10 nights in June. While the hotel is very comfortable with friendly staff there were a couple of aspects that detracted from a better score. On our arrival the smell,of chlorine from the swimming pool was bordering on being overpowering, fortunately it was less in our 2nd floor bedroom. The WiFi was variable, or non existent. I found that if my iPad was disconnected for more than a couple of hours it was necessary to reconnect with password etc. before using again. For the final 4 days of my stay there was no internet connection to either my iPad, or iPhone. Apparently this was not the case if using a laptop with Ethernet connection. Very disappointing and very frustrating. On one day I drove to the Holiday Inn Express at w. Indore Place, Littleton to connect to the Internet via wifi. However it is fair to say the hotel is superbly situated just a few hundred yards from I25 which is the route to everywhere.

owner_response.author: Sonya T, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites: Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello,
Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us at the Holiday Inn & Suites Englewood. We would like to offer our sincerest apology for the inconvenience of our WiFi connection being anything but acceptable. We have however fixed the issue and upped our bandwidth over the last week. We are thrilled to see you enjoyed the other aspects of your stay and our location near I25 served you well. We do hope to see you again in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good
data.text: I stayed here with my family, and overall it was good. Room is kinda tiny, but has spacious bath room and the front desk staffs were very friendly. The pool is not that big if you see it in person, but other than that, it is in the best location in tech center area, and is very clean.

owner_response.author: Sonya T, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites: Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Sean,
Thank you for your kind words regarding your stay at the Holiday Inn Express & Suites Denver Tech Center. We are thrilled you and your family enjoyed your experience with us. We do hope the next time you are in the area, you and your family choose to stay with us again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Holiday Inn Express & Suites - DTC - Englewood, CO
data.text: The front desk staff are quite accommodating and say all the right things, and that is where it all stops.  The hotel is a bit older, however a nice job was done in making some updates.  My room was a suite which was nice, the TV remote for the living area television did not work, which I reported.  The following day I informed the front desk staff that the TV in the living area received at best 50% of the channels the bedroom TV received and the remote still did not work.  That evening when I returned to the hotel, I was informed it was a known issue with both the cable service and WiFi and the new management would be addressing the problems.  They offered me 10,000 points to be added to my rewards program for this inconvenience, which I accepted.  To date (checked out 2 weeks ago), I have not received the 10,000 points nor have I received the 300 welcome points I was told I would receive.  Then there is breakfast, I had to inform the front desk after waiting an unreasonable amount of time that there was no food.  The desk staff went to the person responsible for the food line and within a few more minutes, there was hot food. I choose to stay at Holiday Inn & Express as I travel extensively around the country, but this was the worst experience I have ever encountered and for that reason, I would not recommend this hotel.

owner_response.author: IHGService, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites: Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear LawrenceC501,

Thank you for being an IHG Rewards Club member and for taking the time to share your comments. We regret that you did not fully enjoy your stay with us as we fell short in some details particularly with the Wi-fi connection, breakfast selections, and with the staff service. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience these issues may have caused you. We take comments such as these very seriously and would like to follow up with you. We have sent you a private message to obtain more information. 

Thank you for staying with us and I look forward to hearing back from you very soon.

Sincerely,

Christian C.
Case Manager
IHGService
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Poor Wi-Fi and TV service
data.text: Holiday Inn has done a good job at revamping their hotels and this hotel along with its staff were great. The downsides to this hotel are the Wi-Fi was tremendously slow and in addition, 80% of the channels on the TV wouldn't work.

owner_response.author: IHGService, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites: Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Jeffrey T,

Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay with us. We are pleased to know that you found our hotel and staff to be great. However, we would like to apologize for falling short of your expectations regarding our internet connection and TV channel. Your feedback is troubling and will surely be looked into. Rest assured it will be reviewed and most certainly be forwarded to the appropriate departments to ensure similar situations can be avoided in the future.

We value you as our guest and hope to have another opportunity to provide you with a much better experience.

Sincerely,

Joel A
Case Manager
IHGService
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not up to usual standards
data.text:
Clean, nice hotel but the television service is terrible - had to turn it off because about every minute or two the voice gets skipped. The quality of the system is very poor - hard to get the channel to change or volume moved. Could be the remote but tried at the tv and got the same response. 

Bathroom is too dark - need brighter light.

Can't watch tv from the chair in the room because the refrigerator blocks part of the screen.

The lamps on the side of the bed should have receptacles for charging electronics.

Breakfast bar is good and all the employees are very friendly and always smiling and offering assistance.

Price was better than expected!

owner_response.author: Sonya T, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites: Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Tony,

I would like to apologize for your experience that did not live up to your IHG standards, we are thrilled to hear you enjoyed the fantastic breakfast and our employees served you well.  As of 4/8/2016 this hotel has gone under new ownership and management and we are working hard to ensure all of these issues are addressed immediately. We very much appreciate your feedback and do hope you give us another try the next time you are in the Denver Tech Center!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Feces on our bedding YUCK
data.text: OMG this place is disgusting.  We checked into room 208 and 206 had just put our bags down when my husband sat on the bed putting his hand in feces.  We called down to the front desk to complain.  They sent the cleaning staff up to change the bedding but we were unable to move rooms because we had two rooms with our children with us and there were no other rooms side by side.  We were told the manager was going to call us back which he never did.  Then the next morning when we went to check out the manager Joseph refused to comp us the room.  We were not even asking for both rooms just ours as we felt that was more than fair.  He started with offering a 20% discount we refused that.  He then went so far as to accuse us of putting the feces there because it was "fresh" and even called the cleaning lady over to tell us it was "fresh". We already knew that because my husband put his hand in it!!!!!! He then offered 50% then 60% but said he would get in trouble if he comped the room .  Joseph did not at anytime seem disturbed that his staff somehow missed feces on the bedding of his hotel not to mention the health hazard.  We left without accepting any kind of discount as it is not about the money it is about customer service.  We will also be contacting the Heath department as well.  Disgusting and shame on you Joseph the manger.

owner_response.author: IHGService, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites: Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Kelly F,

Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced due to the level of service you have received. It is truly regrettable to learn that your stay was less than desirable. Please allow me to follow-up on your concerns and give us the opportunity to make it up to you. I have sent you a private message in an effort to obtain additional information. I look forward to your response.

Sincerely,

Faith R
Case Manager
IHGService
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice Place
data.text: This is a nice hotel with very good customer service and fantastic location. Not far from interstate, shopping & dining.  The indoor pool/hot tub is well maintained along with the rooms, hallways & grounds. All this and a good price.

data.title: My stay leaves me not wanting to return
data.text:
First room TV would not work, shower overhead was , looked like the ceiling was leaking.

Hotel is dated and needs updating. Carpets especially are dated and worn .

Staff friendly and accommodating , just the hotel is older and needs a new face lift .

Not like a new holiday inn express experience !

owner_response.author: IHGService, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites: Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear lily10002000,

Thank you for staying with us during your business trip and for writing a candid review. We are glad you have regarded our staff friendly and accommodating. However, we regret that you found our hotel needs to be updated. Your feedback is instrumental for us to upgrade what we can offer to our valued guests to achieve 100% guest satisfaction. I have taken note of your valuable feedback, this will be forwarded to management to consider for improvements.

Once again, we thank you for staying with us. We are looking forward to an opportunity in serving you better on your next visit.

Sincerely,

Dianne L.
Case Manager
IHGService
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: We're on a roll with Holiday Inn Express @ DTC Englewood, Colorado
data.text:
As an IHG member I try to stay at Holiday Inn Express for the majority of my travels. As I checked in at the Denver Tech Center Englewood property I was acknowledged as a platinum member (made this nobody feel like I was a somebody :) and quickly directed to my "suite". Really? For little ole me? Wow, what a beautiful room/suite. Two TV's, small kitchenette, living room with a fold out bed and seperate bedroom.  The restroom was spacious with a bathtub/shower (I really like this after a long day) and great lighting.  This must be a newer facility as everything was clean, sleek and comfortable.  
Since this facility is near my 2nd office location, I will look forward to future stays at this great hotel.  Thank you for the opportunity to share my experience.

data.title: ADA Room
data.text:
The ADA room with roll-in shower was roomy and clean with plenty of space for my wife to manuever her wheel chair.  The things that made the stay average or maybe below average were the beeping smoke detector, television that would not receive all the channels it was supposed to and a hand held shower hose that was too short.  They have only one room with roll-in shower that the desk clerk was aware of, so we couldn't move to a room with a working smoke detector.  The clerk couldn't replace the battery in the special detector that are used in ADA rooms, so he disconnected it and removed it from the room.  He also did not know how to reprogram the television to receive the local stations that were blocked, so we missed the NFL playoff games. The hand help shower head has a hose that is too short to reach the back of the shower bench making it very difficult for my wife to wash and rinse her back or hair.

On the plus side, there were a number of families with small children at the hotel but the hallways were quiet and we were not disturbed.  There was no traffic noise and the Brightside breakfast items were hot and kept fresh.

The desk clerks were very polite and tried to be helpful, but they had no manager or maintenance person to fall back on and apparently are not trained on how to deal with the issues.  I did leave a note on check out to be passed on to maintenance on Monday.

owner_response.author: IHGService, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites: Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Minerbob,

We appreciate your time in writing this review. We are glad to hear that your overall stay was to your satisfaction. On the other hand, I am very sorry for the issues you experienced with the smoke detector and television channels. We appreciate your comments as it is only with feedback like these that we can continually improve our product and services. 

Thank you for being our guest and I do hope we will have the opportunity of welcoming you back to our hotel in the future.

Sincerely,

Christian C.
Case Manager
IHGService
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: It's a Holiday Inn Express!
data.text:
I usually pick Holiday Inn properties for my business travels, mostly because prices are fair, they are predictable, reliable lodging alternatives.  This one is no different.  It was clean and comfortable.
My only complaint is that there are not too many restaurant options within easy walking distance.  I took the Uber here, and there is an Italian place across the parking lot, but not many other options.

No surprises, it's a Holiday Inn Express!
